alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Pickens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 9:51AM EST until January 04 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, Anderson and Pickens. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 946 AM EST, High levels of runoff from this morning`s heavy rainfall will continue to work through area basins through midday. Lingering areas of high water across greater Easley, Powdersville, Liberty, Central and Pendleton will continue to gradually recede, but above bankfull conditions will continue across larger streams and creeks such as Eighteen Mile, Three and Twenty and Six and Twenty Creeks. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Easley, Clemson, West Greenville, Welcome, Powdersville, Central, Pendleton, Liberty, Norris, Lake Hartwell and Sandy Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
